pros: There is a lot advantages for example tuition reimbursement.
cons: I don't see any cons in this company.

review_title: We do the best work here!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Towson, MD
pros: I am working for another hospital prn and they do not do as good of a job as we do in the OR. I am so proud to say that we really give the best patient care!
cons: I would love a raise. Haha!

pros: UM St Joseph Medical Center is a really great place to work. The lab is well structured and the work load is not too much.
cons: We were slightly understaffed during my time due to few people retiring. I am not sure if the situation is the same now.

pros: Staff helpful, Opportunities to learn
cons: The pay is lower compared to other places

pros: Can learn a lot of different things
cons: Employee Scheduling management is not ideal

review_title: Could be a good place to work under different management
pros: Enjoyable work atmosphere with direct coworkers and patients.
cons: Nobody in hospital administration takes responsibility for their work. Incompetence in administration has no consequences. Lack of respect for physician’s work, a culture of retaliation and threats causes physicians to leave after a short time.

pros: Overall a nice place to work
cons: each unit is very different and manager makes a huge difference in your experience, ever changing policies and rules make it rather tedious

job_title: Acute Care Nurse Practitioner in Towson, MD
pros: Family conscious, quality focused, good work environment
cons: Staff shortage is hitting everyone hard

pros: Location, hours, schedule, cafeteria, parking
cons: Politics, training, salary, management, benefits

pros: Great doctors, nice staff, close to home
cons: Unqualified and poor management that does not correct poor performance.

review_title: Great and compassionate coworkers awful management.
pros: Best coworkers. Best patient care ever encountered. Highest patient care standards. Well respected within the community. Values life and reference and compassion. Nurses and doctors are wonderful.
cons: Management does not care about nursing nor do they have the nurses back or the nurses interest at heart. They do not listen to nurses. This unfortunately affects the entire hospital. If you keep your nurses happy your patients will be happy too. Desperately needs to be unionized. Staff is horribly abused. They take take take and never give. Nurses and doctors are fighting to give the best patient care they can while also meeting all of the expectations placed upon them by management. It is an impossible job. Sadly losing really great staff because of how out of touch management is.

pros: Great coworkers. Religious traditions, spiritual care. Caring staff. Not a city hospital so free parking and no traumas. Excellent cardiac, Ortho, OB, and stroke center.
cons: More and more being put on the staff without compensation or appreciation; more is being taken from staff including disability and bonuses. Docs and nurses care and are dedicated but are getting burned out.

pros: People are friendly. Pay is not bad. Pretty happy overall with the new job, but management was not upfront about everything in the interview. They're willing to work with you, but you have to stand up for yourself and push them a little bit to get it done. I like that they give you a lot of freedom and independence to do your work the way you feel is right, but they also have good procedures in place to guide you in the right direction as well.
cons: The layoffs and financial worries created some drama, because again, management wasn't upfront about it and therefore rumors were flying around.

review_title: A Great Place to Work - Engaged CEO
pros: SJMC has a family feel.  Everyone says "hi" when you walk down the hallway.  Dr. Smyth is very focused on process improvement and is dedicated to the employees here and the work they do at the hospital.  Since we are part of the University of Maryland System, there is a lot of opportunity to move around and move up in your career.
cons: Sometimes being part of a larger system, there is a lot of bureaucracy to go through to get things done.   The shared services system is hard to work with.  They make it difficult to get answers to simple questions.

review_title: The place went from decent to downhill in a hot minute
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: Nice location, easy to get to from KS or MO.  They have a base of loyal employees who have been there for a million years.  The rest is high turnover.
cons: They changed from being a great employer who cared about their employees into a company in financial crisis mode who completely abandoned the majority of the things that made it a good place to work.  After the economy recovered, they didn't bring back any of the good things they had stripped.  Perhaps it's okay for people who weren't there before, but trust me.  It used to be an okay place to work, and now it's not.

pros: Large facility that has many positions available to choose from.
cons: Talk is cheap.  Although there is plenty of talk describing the missions and values all employees are to strive for; when it comes to actually valuing the employee as a respected hard worker, the bottom line is the first concern.  Managers are so far removed from the clinical setting, they are not available when you really need them.  Charge nurse positions are not encouraged yet very needed.  The staff to patient ratio is always a concern.  Even the units that are "money makers", do not get the staff ratios they require to prevent burn out and vacation leave when asked for.

pros: Community hospital full of people who truly care about our patients and work hard to give them the best care.  I could make more money working somewhere else but I like the feeling I get when I come to work, I like the culture.
cons:
Money is tight and everyone is being asked to do more with less.   
As a bedside nurse, I am required to work a lot of weekends and holidays.

pros: Most of the people are wonderful, they just need good role models from the top
cons: Too much turnover at executive level, bandaid type management, no follow thru from top down, need better role models from the top All the CNO's and there were many in my short tenure treated their direct reports with utter disrespect, to the point of cussing them, and talking about them to other directors

job_title: Medical Technologist (Lab) in Perry Hall, MD
pros: As a hospital (for the patient) it's a great place. Not such a great place to be employed.
cons: benefits could be better. pay is fine. The biggest problem I have is with communication. Leadership does not communicate well at all, my department, especially, was horrible at communicating with their employees. Also, there is a big problem with keeping supplies in stock, which is very frustrating when you're trying to do your job.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: Staff understands unplanned events happen , they are willing to work with you to get time off. I really enjoy working with people who have common goals and want to aid the improvement of the quality of life of others. Working together to make sure people have the life saving and life changing medication they need, is very rewarding.
cons: Emergencies  are dealt with  on the spot, the department deals with just enough to get to the next day

pros: As a contract of Cardinal health, pharmacist's salary is great compared to other hospitals in Houston. $500 bonus and ~2% raise yearly.
cons: Health care benefits are not so good. PTO is 140 hours for all pharmacists who do 7-on-7-off rotations. This facility is owned by IASIS and Cardinal is the contract that provides medication services. So, sometimes hospital management's goals are not in the best interest for the pharmacy or pharmacists.

pros: Benefits are good, great co-workers to be with, Mission and Vision statement is a basis to follow
cons: No opportunity for advancement.  No support from Administration for the employees.  Administration is never seen nor do the employees know their names.  The Administrators do not follow the Mission and Vision statement.  Staffing is at a critical level in a number of departments which does not deliver good, safe patient care.

review_title: Very friendly and helpful staff with focus on patient care
pros: The people in the department and throughout the hospital are generally very nice people to work with.  Parking garage for employees is free and kept clean, as is the hospital itself.
cons: Too many managers and pay is low compared to other hospitals in immediate and even rural areas.

pros: A pleasure being a patient advocate and giving assistance when needed. Some of the staff was great, professional and friendly.
cons: Not enough hours in the day for the heavy work load. Although, I like to stay busy but not that busy and having to watch the clock so as not to go into overtime.

review_title: It was a good place to work, but seems to be a sinking ship at this time.
pros: They have some of the most competent physicians around.
cons: However, some of these Dr.'s are leaving the hospital due to administration issues.

review_title: Great hospital to be a patient at. Poor hospital to work at. Work-life balance is not there
pros: Everyone is committed to patient safety
cons: If you are salary they work you to death. Vacation benefits are not the same as the rest of the University of Maryland system. Holidays are factored into your paid time off vacation time. So you think going in you have good vacation and it's comparable to the rest of the hospital's but it's not

review_title: Nice but needs some workings from the inside
pros: Great location to work, Towson area. Mid size local hospital with a big hospital feel. Friendly staff to work with and has some degree of interdepartmental unity.
cons: Everything shouldn,t be about the budget when it comes to true patient care; from the support services, up to the Executive Board. You can't put a cost on true quality when it comes down to patient care..

pros: It's a job and that is all.
cons: Management, culture, quality of patient care, treatment of new employees, overworked cranky nurses.

pros: They offered a flexible schedule
cons: Labor and Delivery Dept. exposed me to a very, very sick child I was supposed to "babysit" while mom was delivering. I later complained all the way to the top, with no authentic response. Just bureaucratic double-talk saying it was my perception, etc. I wound up sick for two weeks after that. Wow. So Christian. It makes me sick. Never a word of follow-up.

pros:
it was a good job 

there is a lot of opportunity for 30+ hours of  overtime if you are up it
cons: but you have to b careful because everyone in there its trying to keep there job and they will back stab you at any given moment

pros: It was a lot of good team work when working at the hospital and it teaches you a lot when working by yourself
cons: There wasn't really anything that was to much to handle or to hard to do everything was basically simple things to do

pros: Able to expand my skill set with very supportive administration and physicians.
cons: None at this time in my employment

job_title: Director of Quality in Towson, MD
pros: Staff, leadership and the caring attitude towards our patients.   Always striving to do better and be the best.
cons: Working within the State CMS waiver system and being a part of a larger system.

pros: Good pay and benefits. Global organization encouraging advancing career with tuition reimbursement.
cons: Medical leadership is an all boys club. Even if you are well qualified educated if you are girk you will not be promoted.

pros: They offer a great benefit package with a variety of choices and they aslo give Vacation time and sick time as two different accurals.
cons: Need provide employees with better

job_title: Certified Patient Care Technician in Merriam, KS
pros: Like family. Everyone is so kind.
cons: Very day-shift minded. Night shift get's forgotten about for a lot of things or we have to come in a lot earlier or stay a lot later to go to meetings or other things.

job_title: Was An RN In Various Roles in Towson Park, MD
pros: Excellent team work. Genuinely caring peers. Standard excellent
cons: Sometimes there is a disconnect between upper management, who do not see, much less experience, the realities involved in working the "floors".

pros: Team members working in all 4 boroughs are very cooperative and nice to work with.
cons: Problem is with management - important things that need to be addressed to staff are always kept in secret, hence, fast staff turnover

pros: Good pay; lots of overtime
cons: Poor coordination of depts, and hiring fresh nurses with nothing to offer just for cheap labor

review_title: St. Joseph Medical Center talks but most importantly, walks their mission statement.
pros: This system is clearly patient focused and departments work well together.
cons: They tend not to support RN staff into leadership positions.

pros: The mission for UM-St. Joseph Medical Center is providing excellent patient care.
cons: There are no negative comments about this employer

pros: great environment, team work is life, patients are awesome.
